airtest.core.api module¶

Airtest Main API

connect_device(uri)[source]¶

Initialize device with uri and set as current dievce.

e.g.
  • android:/// # local adb device using default params
  • android://192.168.55.55:5037/1234566?cap_method=javacap&touch_method=adb
  • windows:/// # local windows application
  • ios:/// # ios device
Parameters:uri – android://adbhost:adbport/serialno?param=value
Returns:device instance
device()[source]¶

Get current active device.

Returns:current device instance
set_current(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Set current active device.

Parameters:index – index of initialized device instance
Returns:None
shell(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Execute shell command on device.

Parameters:cmd – command line, e.g. “ls /data/local/tmp”
Returns:output of the shell cmd
start_app(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Start app on device.

Parameters:
  • package – package name of the app, e.g. “com.netease.my”
  • activity – activity to start, default to None which is the main activity
Returns:

None
stop_app(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Stop app on device.

Parameters:package – package name of the app, same as start_app
Returns:None
clear_app(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Clear data of an app on device.

Parameters:package – package name of the app, same as start_app
Returns:None
install(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Install app on device.

Parameters:filepath – filepath of the app on host machine
Returns:None
uninstall(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Uninstall app on device.

Parameters:package – package name of the app, same with start_app
Returns:None
snapshot(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Get the screenshot of the device and save it to the file.

Parameters:
  • filename – filename to save the screenshot. Save to ST.LOG_DIR if it’s a relative path
  • msg – message of the screenshot, will be displayed in the report
Returns:

None
wake(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Wake up and unlock the device. May not work on some models.

Returns:None
home(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Return to the home screen of the device.

Returns:None
touch(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Touch on device screen.

Parameters:
  • v – target to touch, either a Template instance or absolute coordinates (x, y)
  • kwargs – platform specific kwargs, please refer to corresponding docs
Returns:

None
swipe(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Swipe on device screen.

Two ways of assigning the parameters
  • swipe(v1, v2=Template(...)) swipe from v1 to v2
  • swipe(v1, vector=(x, y)) swipe starts at v1 and moves along the vector.
Parameters:
  • v1 – start point of swipe, either a Template instance or absolute coordinates
  • v2 – end point of swipe, either a Template instance or absolute coordinates
  • vector – vector of swipe action, either absolute coordinates (x, y) or percentage of screen e.g.(0.5, 0.5)
  • **kwargs – platform specific kwargs, please refer to corresponding docs
Returns:

None
pinch(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Pinch on device screen.

Parameters:
  • in_or_out – pinch in or pinch out, enum in [“in”, “out”]
  • center – center of pinch action, default as None to be center of screen
  • percent – percentage of screen of pinch action, default to be 0.5
Returns:

None
keyevent(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Input keyboard event on device.

Parameters:
  • keyname – platform specific keyname
  • kwargs – platform specific kwargs
Returns:

None
text(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Input text on device.

Text input widget must be active first. :param text: text to input, unicode supported :param enter: input keyevent Enter after text input :return: None

sleep(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

time.sleep, will be displayed in report.

Parameters:secs – seconds to sleep
Returns:None
wait(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Wait for Template on device screen.

Parameters:
  • v – target to wait, Template instance
  • timeout – timeout of wait, default to None which is ST.FIND_TIMEOUT
  • interval – interval seconds after cv match when waiting
  • intervalfunc – interval function to be called after each cv match when the target is not found
Returns:

coordinates of the target found. raise TargetNotFoundError after timeout
exists(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Return if the target exists on device screen.

Parameters:v – target to find
Returns:False if not exists, else coordinates of the target
find_all(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Find all pos of the target on device screen.

Parameters:v – target to find
Returns:list of coordinates, [(x, y), (x1, y1), …]
assert_exists(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Assert target exists on device screen.

Parameters:
  • v – target to find
  • msg – message of assertion, will be displayed in the report
Returns:

coordinates of the target found. raise AssertionError if assertion failed
assert_not_exists(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Assert target does not exist on device screen.

Parameters:
  • v – target to find
  • msg – message of assertion, will be displayed in the report
Returns:

None. raise AssertionError if assertion failed
assert_equal(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Assert first and second are equal.

Parameters:
  • first – first value
  • second – second value
  • msg – message of assertion, will be displayed in the report
Returns:

None, raise AssertionError if assertion failed
assert_not_equal(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Assert first and second are not equal.

Parameters:
  • first – first value
  • second – second value
  • msg – message of assertion, will be displayed in the report
Returns:

None, raise AssertionError if assertion failed
